result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dennis M. WEBER

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
State moves to dismiss and read in this charge, the defendant entered a plea in Case File 15 CM 148.   Motion granted.   
Minutes.
Plea Date reset to 10-27-2015 at 3:00 p.m., Br.1.
Warrant cancelled and returned to Clerk of Court

Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 08-18-15 at 9:30 a.m.   Plea date is set for 09-17-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours and defendant is to have no contact with Bitter Neuman, Edgewater Plumbing, Menards and Mills Fleet Farm.  Bail furnished.   Court orders the arrest warrant to be quashed.   
Minutes.

Defendant failed to appear for initial appearance.  Arrest warrant authorized.   
Minutes.

Prior to intake beginning, the defendant was concerned if he was in the right court room and if he court date was today.  I checked CCAP and told him it is set for 04-20-15 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 1.  
Notice given to defendant.

RE:  Schroeders, on 01-22-15.
Initial appearance is set for 04-20-15 at 1:30 p.m.
